triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control problems specifically for multiagent systems with multiple interacting intelligent agents.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on nonlinear multiagent systems and develops control strategies for nonlinear dynamics.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: The paper explicitly uses the backstepping method as the framework for controller design.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an NN-based composite dynamic surface control strategy for improved approximating performance.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: The paper uses Lyapunov stability theory to prove that all signals in the closed-loop system are semi-globally uniformly ultimately bounded.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: The paper proposes disturbance observers and estimation models as part of the composite dynamic surface control scheme.

triples.name: Active disturbance rejection control
triples.relevance: The disturbance observer approach is related to ADRC techniques for handling unknown dynamics and external disturbances.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the foundational framework for all control design and stability analysis in the paper.

triples.name: Robot control
triples.relevance: The formation control problem addressed is applicable to robotic systems and swarm robotics control.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: The paper develops a closed-loop control system with feedback mechanisms to achieve prescribed performance.
